results.content: If you have no experience with a framework (or in this case a library that can work as a framework) this is the best course I've seen. A lot of other courses either gloss over the basics too fast or they give you every detail about every possible way to do something, which can be very confusing. What this course does is it explains the basics in a way that is easy to understand and will allow you to get a feel for how React works. By the end of the class you will have a general understanding of how to render components and use some ES6 features like map and filter to manipulate data using your components. I recommend taking this class if you are entirely new to frameworks before you try taking any class geared toward more intermediate or advanced level students.
results.content_html: If you have no experience with a framework (or in this case a library that can work as a framework) this is the best course I've seen. A lot of other courses either gloss over the basics too fast or they give you every detail about every possible way to do something, which can be very confusing. What this course does is it explains the basics in a way that is easy to understand and will allow you to get a feel for how React works. By the end of the class you will have a general understanding of how to render components and use some ES6 features like map and filter to manipulate data using your components. I recommend taking this class if you are entirely new to frameworks before you try taking any class geared toward more intermediate or advanced level students.

results.content: I took React classes from other Udemy instructors before, though they taught more advanced concepts at a faster speed, I struggled to understand props, states and how to incorporate them into a basic React app, this course has helped me have a clear understanding of those concepts. I personally this course is highly recommended to anyone who is new to React/JavaScript ES6 and for those who want to grasp the solid basic essence before moving on to more advanced topics.

I personally this course is highly recommended to anyone who is new to React/JavaScript ES6 and for those who want to grasp the solid basic essence before moving on to more advanced topics.

results.content: Rob delivers exactly what he promises: confidence to tackle other React courses in the future, plus a stronger grip on JavaScript fundamentals like array methods and the "this" keyword. If you've already completed your first JavaScript course, this one will be an invaluable resource both for drilling what you already know, and for getting your feet wet with React.

If you've already completed your first JavaScript course, this one will be an invaluable resource both for drilling what you already know, and for getting your feet wet with React.

results.content:
This was a wonderful way to kick start my ReactJS learning as most of the online tutorials out there assume that readers have the basic knowledge of getting setup. I was able to grab the basic concepts and get a boilerplate going and modify part of an existing project and experiment.

Would like to see less repetition on some simple concepts though, as well as references to websites out there that have been built using ReactJS and what Design Patterns were followed as well as what tools (IDE's, etc) were used.

Would like to see less repetition on some simple concepts though, as well as references to websites out there that have been built using ReactJS and what Design Patterns were followed as well as what tools (IDE's, etc) were used.

results.content:
It is nice to find a React course that does not require a large amount of setup and sticks to the basics of React. Might be a little too beginner for some people but a nice short tutorial that can be played at 1.5x to quickly get to grips with React if you are a pro. The tutor does explain the contents of each video at the start to make it easier to pick ones to skip.

One grumble.
Not sure on the tutors filing system, e.g. index1 - index2 - index3 - index4 etc... and section-one section-three section-two etc...

Hope the lecturer finds some time to finish the course as I feel this is a really easy one to follow for beginners to React

results.content: I have prior programming exercise. But most of other react trainers use a lot of predefined kits to explain React. But Rob Merrill, the trainer, did a fantastic job of using just a single html to demonstrate React with no other paraphernalia. This made learning very easy. Plus his introduction to various terminology without too much complication helps the focus on the current topic under discussion. If you have just learned JavaScript and want to explore React, this course is for you. The trainer is going to cover advanced JS concepts like fat arrows as required in this course.
results.content_html: I have prior programming exercise. But most of other react trainers use a lot of predefined kits to explain React. But Rob Merrill, the trainer, did a fantastic job of using just a single html to demonstrate React with no other paraphernalia. This made learning very easy. Plus his introduction to various terminology without too much complication helps the focus on the current topic under discussion. If you have just learned JavaScript and want to explore React, this course is for you. The trainer is going to cover advanced JS concepts like fat arrows as required in this course.

results.content:
I love the way this course has been structured: the instructor's main teaching strategy is repetition, and it works.  

Concepts are clearly explained (React, but also JS objects, functional programming, etc., all that you need to master React fundamentals), repeated with examples, then tons of small challenges reinforce learning.  Finally, at each stage, that is, at the end of all this work done with each concept, all this knowledge is applied on a practical project that gets improved on each iteration.  Then, the course proceeds to a more complex concept, in a logical structure.  

The pace may seem a bit slow, but it's part of the teaching strategy, and I think it works extremely well in the context of this course's structure, at least judging by the amazing progress I've been making: everything sinks in in the end!  It'd be great to have a follow-up course with more advanced and real-world React knowledge, but taught with the same method.  

If you've been frustrated with other React courses before, because they go over your head, this one is fantastic.  Highly recommended.
results.content_html:
I love the way this course has been structured: the instructor's main teaching strategy is repetition, and it works.

Concepts are clearly explained (React, but also JS objects, functional programming, etc., all that you need to master React fundamentals), repeated with examples, then tons of small challenges reinforce learning. Finally, at each stage, that is, at the end of all this work done with each concept, all this knowledge is applied on a practical project that gets improved on each iteration. Then, the course proceeds to a more complex concept, in a logical structure.

The pace may seem a bit slow, but it's part of the teaching strategy, and I think it works extremely well in the context of this course's structure, at least judging by the amazing progress I've been making: everything sinks in in the end! It'd be great to have a follow-up course with more advanced and real-world React knowledge, but taught with the same method.

If you've been frustrated with other React courses before, because they go over your head, this one is fantastic. Highly recommended.

results.content: I wanted to learn React and started with Stephen Griders "Modern React with Redux [2019]" (up to section 6) but noticed that i'm not that prepared for this course. I finished section 5 already and it's great. Rob did a great job so far. He explains and repeats the fundamentals that often that i had to switch the speed on 1.25 - but thats just great! Because i do this i know that i understand what he wants to teach me. After finishing Robs course i will continue with Stephens! Thumbs up!

results.content: Overall, I think this course is fantastic.  Rob Merrill is an excellent instructor that guides his students with knowledge of each section.  With each section, Rob provides a basic in-depth explanation of each subject along with an example of how to apply the knowledge learned.  He is also very quick to send replies to questions you may have and makes excellent recommendations for how to further your knowledge in a this particular subject.  The one area I would like to see improvement is the React Form Section.  I feel that it should include submitting more than one single input.  Perhaps using multiple input text fields, radio buttons, and checkboxes to expand upon the power of React Forms.  It seems to be a place where a lot of new React Developers struggle.  Bottom Line:  I think this course is perfect for any person wanting to get into React Development, however, there are courses one should complete first before jumping into React.  Having basic HTML, CSS, JavaScript experience is a MUST.  Luckily, Rob has an excellent JavaScript course available here on Udemy as well.
results.content_html: Overall, I think this course is fantastic. Rob Merrill is an excellent instructor that guides his students with knowledge of each section. With each section, Rob provides a basic in-depth explanation of each subject along with an example of how to apply the knowledge learned. He is also very quick to send replies to questions you may have and makes excellent recommendations for how to further your knowledge in a this particular subject. The one area I would like to see improvement is the React Form Section. I feel that it should include submitting more than one single input. Perhaps using multiple input text fields, radio buttons, and checkboxes to expand upon the power of React Forms. It seems to be a place where a lot of new React Developers struggle. Bottom Line: I think this course is perfect for any person wanting to get into React Development, however, there are courses one should complete first before jumping into React. Having basic HTML, CSS, JavaScript experience is a MUST. Luckily, Rob has an excellent JavaScript course available here on Udemy as well.

results.content_html: Straight forward and easy to follow. Amazing for fist time React devs. Also works for folks who needed a quick refresher on the basics to get those fingers moving.

There was one bit missed. in the first few lessons we were taught for example:

var Color = function() {..}

but then it was changed to:

function Color() = {...}

There was nothing to tell what the difference was. I had figure out that they are both the same.

results.content: This course was exactly what I was hoping it would be, a great learning experience where I would come away having actually learned how to do what they are claiming! I am currently near the end of a techdegree at another online web development learning platform and I have been so overwhelmed. The instructors teach as if we already know what they're teaching, and having no background in javascript, it's been a nightmare! It has taken twice as long because I just didn't get it. I thought something was wrong with me, now I know it's just that they were talking over my head. Rob teaches and then reinforces what he has taught so we can understand and put it to use. I need more courses like this one! Bravo!

results.content:
That was a great introductory course to React world.
I am trying to learn react native but since react js uses same terminology and methodology this was a goot getting started course.

My observations:
I would prefer a constant use of ES6 from the begging.
Secondly I would like to see a form example created by independent form components that interact with each other.
Finally from Lifecycle methods only componentDidMount was presented. Maybe tutor could present some more examples on that topic.

I would prefer a constant use of ES6 from the begging.
Secondly I would like to see a form example created by independent form components that interact with each other.
Finally from Lifecycle methods only componentDidMount was presented. Maybe tutor could present some more examples on that topic.

I'm happy with the course it taught me the react basics very well. Now I will be moving forward to take the bigger courses confidently.

results.content:
This is a very introductory course. But if you are new to this, this is where you would start. This instructor makes a great effort to explain the material.
I hope he teaches more advanced levels.

As I said, I hope this instructor teaches more advanced react courses along with react-native, react-router and redux. I hope he also explains Life Cycle Functions.

response.content: Hi Al! Thanks for the review :) This course is definitely aimed at those new to JavaScript and React so while it may never get to an advanced level I will continue to add new content taking on more sophisticated content. I look soon to release some lessons on lifecycle methods and Ajax requests!
response.content_html: Hi Al! Thanks for the review :) This course is definitely aimed at those new to JavaScript and React so while it may never get to an advanced level I will continue to add new content taking on more sophisticated content. results.content_html:
This is a very introductory course. But if you are new to this, this is where you would start. This instructor makes a great effort to explain the material.
I hope he teaches more advanced levels.

As I said, I hope this instructor teaches more advanced react courses along with react-native, react-router and redux. I hope he also explains Life Cycle Functions.

Other instructors teaching these classes are very knowledgeable in this material but then they type away at 100mph without much explanation.

results.content: A perfect class for anyone new to react. It covers many important aspects of react and does an excellent job of providing good use cases for common built in javascript functions/helpers that can be used with react. I appreciated the pacing as well, all of the challenges in the course required some critical thinking but I never felt like I was ill equipped to handle them. I was able to figure about 95% of them on my own. Definitely take this course before jumping into more advanced React courses.

results.content:
Simple enough to get up and running productively. While has enough meat to learn the basics of React correctly.

Especially appreciate how Rob ties in his Basic Javascript course to drill in the concepts of React being JS and refresher on JS Object Literals + Dot Notation and Bracket Notation to access JS Object's props.

results.content:
I love this course! I had a bit of ReactJS knowledge before taking this course, but I lacked clarity on how to use this knowledge in real life on top of not fully understanding most of the concepts... this course is very clear and easy to follow. I finally know how to use ReactJS and understand the reason behind the code. 
Highly recommend!
